contentText.text: Jian accepted the wine – but was this the right choice?

instructionText.text: Click on Next to reconsider your decision and try again.

popText.text: The next day, Jian emailed Eduardo to ask if he had arranged the wine. Eduardo admits it. “I wanted you to get the full value of your gift!” he writes.
After his conversation with Eduardo, Jian does some research online. He learns that the wine is valued at over USD$200 a bottle.

This makes him nervous, as he realizes that he is supposed to disclose any gifts over USD$200. He also begins to realize that a restaurant gift certificate is considered a cash equivalent – regardless of value – which is also prohibited under Johnson Controls policy.
Jian realizes that accepting the gift card and the wine was wrong, so he immediately fills out a disclosure form on http://complianceforms.jci.com, then goes to talk to the Law department.
Jian is reprimanded for accepting the gift card and the wine, but is praised for disclosing what happened.
